item.title: How do I turn my server on? (I mean how do I make it public?)
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Look, bro. This is some pretty simple stuff. Every single comment here is completely bullshit. The correct way:
Press the start button (Left bottom hand corner) and find “CMD” without quotes. Then, type in “ipconfig” without quotes. Then, scroll all the way to the top. It should say something like this…
IPv4 Address. . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.2.104
Now, see where it says “104”? Put that in the “???” place that you mentioned.
Use no - ip, too… If you already haven’t. :p. You don’t need to change anything in the CLIENT.JAVA yet… That has absolutely NOTHING to do with portforwarding. Just do what I said and you’ll be fine … I guess. And for TCP/UDP, it should only be TCP…

Read full topic

item.title: How do I turn my server on? (I mean how do I make it public?)
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You have port forwarded to 192.168.1.???. In command prompt on the computer the server will be running on type “ipconfig” then enter. You will see IP Address:. Put that in the “Server IP Address” box on the server config page.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I turn my server on? (I mean how do I make it public?)
item.dc:creator: @DJ_Whizz DJ Whizz
item.description:
@DJ_Whizz wrote:

Yeah I know that but how do I make it public then?
because my ip is whizzscape.no-ip.biz.
port is 43594
and all my friends are saying it says “Error Connecting To Server”
Please, a decent answer =[[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 08, 2008, 03:16:18 AM[/size][hr]HOW DO I MAKE IT PUBLICCCCC? =[[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 08, 2008, 03:17:43 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Mary|Jane, post:3, topic:197331”]You don’t edit that…

You leave it how it is, and double-click the runserver.bat[/quote]
I know that I can click runserver.bat but my friends are saying that it says: Error Connecting To Server.

@sickedank wrote:

no no…

There is no need to edit files to change your ip.

Just let that code be.

Also, even if you did have to change it, the last one is an interface. That is text.

item.title: How do I turn my server on? (I mean how do I make it public?)
item.dc:creator: @DJ_Whizz DJ Whizz
item.description:
@DJ_Whizz wrote:

Look im [size=30pt]really[/size] really stuck!

[code]playerServer = “5.53.142.141”;

if(loadmoreinfo() == 3){
returnCode = 5;
playerName = “_”;
disconnected = true;[/code]
Look is that correct because in my previous ones i’ve been changing the 5.53.142.141 to whizz-scape.no-ip.biz which looks like this:

[code]playerServer = “whizzscape.no-ip.biz”;

if(loadmoreinfo() == 3){
returnCode = 5;
playerName = “_”;
disconnected = true;[/code]

Can someone please help me!?
there is also this one:

try{ for(int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++){ for(int i2 = 0; i2 < playerItems.length; i2++){ for(int i3 = 0; i3 < playerEquipment.length; i3++){ if(bankItems[i] < 1 && bankItemsN[i] < 1 && playerItems[i2] < 1 && playerItemsN[i2] < 1 && playerEquipment[i3] < 1){ loadcharbackup(); loadmoreinfo(); loadquestinterface(); loadweather(); loadothers(); loggedinpm(); playerServer = "5.53.152.141"; } else { sendMessage("You're not reset...");

I did the same again changed the 5.53.152.141 to whizzscape.no-ip.biz, am I doing this correct?

then do I also change this one:

sendQuest("@dre@Server Information Menu", 8144); //Title clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("@dbl@Server Information", 8145); sendQuest("@dbl@Server IP: @gre@"+"5.53.106.141", 8147); sendQuest("@dbl@Players Online: @gre@"+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 8148); sendQuest("@dbl@Server Hoster And Creator: @dre@"+"Admin Dj Whizz", 8149); sendQuest("@dbl@Server Admins: @dbl@"+"Admin King Bryce", 8150); sendQuest(" ", 8151); sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@"+" ---", 8152); sendQuest("@dbl@WebSite: @red@"+"www.pimpscape.tk", 8153); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream();

Do I change the 5.53.106.141 to whizzscape.no-ip.biz aswell?

Some picture links to help you:

portforwarding.jpg593×696

[size=50pt]SOMEONE HELP ME!!![/size][br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 07, 2008, 03:32:12 PM[/size][hr]Please, can someone help me =[

Look, I know people say leave it and click runserver.bat, well thats what i’ve always done. But the annoying thing is… is that if I just leave it how do I make it public?

I already know that my brother can get on because he’s got same IP as me. Someone please help with one decent answer.

Read full topic
